verses.verse: Therefore I will look to the LORD; I will (Ps. 130:5; Is. 25:9; Lam. 3:24, 25) wait for the God of my salvation; My God will hear me.

(Israel’s Confession and Comfort) (Prov. 24:17; Obad. 12; (Acts 10:43)) Do not rejoice over me, my enemy; (Ps. 37:24; (Prov. 24:16); 2 Cor. 4:9) When I fall, I will arise; When I sit in darkness, The LORD will be a light to me.

(Lam. 3:39, 40; (2 Cor. 5:21)) I will bear the indignation of the LORD, Because I have sinned against Him, Until He pleads my (Jer. 50:34) case And executes justice for me. He will bring me forth to the light; I will see His righteousness.

Then she who is my enemy will see, And (Ps. 35:26) shame will cover her who said to me, (Ps. 42:3) “Where is the LORD your God?” My eyes will see her; Now she will be trampled down Like mud in the streets.
In the day when your (Is. 54:11; (Amos 9:11)) walls are to be built, In that day the decree shall go far and wide.
In that day ((Is. 11:16; 19:23-25)) they shall come to you From Assyria and the fortified cities, From the fortress to the River, From sea to sea, And mountain to mountain.
Yet the land shall be desolate Because of those who dwell in it, And (Jer. 21:14) for the fruit of their deeds.

(God Will Forgive Israel) Shepherd Your people with Your staff, The flock of Your heritage, Who dwell solitarily in a (Is. 37:24) woodland, In the midst of Carmel; Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead, As in days of old.
“As (Ps. 68:22; 78:12) in the days when you came out of the land of Egypt, I will show them (Ex. 34:10) wonders.”
The nations (Is. 26:11) shall see and be ashamed of all their might; (Job 21:5) They shall put their hand over their mouth; Their ears shall be deaf.

They shall lick the (Ps. 72:9; (Is. 49:23)) dust like a serpent; (Ps. 18:45) They shall crawl from their holes like snakes of the earth. (Jer. 33:9) They shall be afraid of the LORD our God, And shall fear because of You.

(Ex. 15:11) Who is a God like You, (Ex. 34:6, 7, 9; Is. 43:25; Jer. 50:20) Pardoning iniquity And passing over the transgression of (Mic. 4:7) the remnant of His heritage? (Ps. 103:8, 9, 13; (Is. 57:16)) He does not retain His anger forever, Because He delights in ((Ezek. 33:11)) mercy.
He will again have compassion on us, And will subdue our iniquities. You will cast all our sins Into the depths of the sea.
(Luke 1:72, 73) You will give truth to Jacob And mercy to Abraham, (Ps. 105:9) Which You have sworn to our fathers From days of old.
The burden (2 Kin. 19:36; Jon. 1:2; Nah. 2:8; Zeph. 2:13) against Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
